0120783055-d-07-26-83-CARR.Accident Cause: Other way and structure defect (Provide detailed description in narrative)
0120783055-d-07-26-83-CARR.Narrative: THIS DERAILMENT INVOLVED A UNIT COAL TRAIN, CONSISTING OF 59 100 KUCX CARS WHICH DEPARTED WORTHVILLE(MP 0.0) SOUTHBOUND AT 1410, 07/26/83, DESTINED TO CLEANCOAL TERMINALS (MP 15.2). A 10 MPH SLOW ORDER WAS IN EFFECT FROM MP 0.0 TO MP 3.0 ACCOUUNT TRACK CONDITIONS, IN ADDITION A 5 MPH SLOW ORDER OVER BRIDGE #2 AT MP 1.7 WAS IN EFFECT ACCOUNT REPAIR WORK IN PROGRESS ON THAT BRIDGE.VARIOUS PILES HADBEEN POSTED, ALSO, DEFECTIVE STRINGERS AND CAPS HAD BEEN REPLACED. THE REMAINING WORK IN PROGRESS WAS THAT OF REPLACING 3 BRIDGE TIES. TO ACCOMPLISH THIS, ALL TRACK SPIKES HAD BEEN PULLED AND THE USABLE BRIDGE TIES HAD BEEN TURNED AND PROPERLY SPACED. ALL THEDEFECTIVE BRIDGE TIES HAD BEEN REMOVED AND 10 NEW TIES HAD BEEN INSERTED. IN PREPARATION FOR THE PASSAGE OF THE TRAIN IN QUESTION, EVERY THIRD TIE WAS SPIKED ON BOTH SIDES OF EACH RAIL. THE MISSING TIES WERE LOCATED BETWEEN THE TIES THAT HAD BEEN SPIKED IN. BRIDGE #2 IS APPROXIMATELY 200 FEET LONG. THE TRACK ALIGNMENT OVER THIS BRIDGE, FROM NORTH TO SOUTH IS TANGENT IN ONE-THIRD OF THS SPAN: THEN, AN EASY CURVE TO THE LEFT FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE SPAN.NoneNoneNone

C83999V-d-07-07-83-CUVA.Narrative: AT 6:10 A.M., JULY 7, 1983, JOB 304, ENGINE CUVA 960 WAS PULLING THREE LOADED IRON LADLES SOUTH FROMTHE BLAST FURNACE. AT THE SAME TIME, JOB 308, ENGINE CUVA 855, WAS HEADING NORTH TOWARD THE HOPPERSTATION WITH 39 LOADED CARS OF COKE. THE 304 JOB WAS INSTRUCTED BY THE YARDMASTER TO COME OUT ON TRACK #100 AND THE 308 JOB HAD TO TRAVEL THE SAME TRACK TO GET TO THE HOPPER STATION TO DELIVER THE COKE. THERE IS A CURVE IN THE TRACK AT THE END OF ONE OF THE BUILDINGS IN THE AREA, AND AS EACH CREW TRAVELLED THE TRACK AND CAME AROUND THE CURVE, THEY SPOTTED ONE ANOTHER AND ATTEMPTED TO STOP, BUT WERE UNABLE TO DO SO AND COLLIDED, HEAD-ON. WHEN IT WAS REALIZED THEY WOULD COLLIDE, J. MEISTERICS, CONDUCTR ON JOB 304, JUMPEF FROM LOCOMOTIVE #960. HE RECEIVED SUPERIFICAL ABRASIONS TO HIS RIGHT KNEE,BOTH ARMS, AND LEFT AXILLARY AREA, AS WELL AS A CONTUSION TO HIS LEFT THUMB. HE WAS OFF WORK 22 DAYS. M. MCCAFFERTY, ENGINEER ON JOB 304, SUSTAINED A SUPERFICIAL ABRASION TO THE RIGHT POSTERIOR THORACIC REGION, AND HAD DISCOMFORT TO HIS NECK. HE MISSED NO WORK DUE TO THIS.NoneNoneNoneNone
